messages.text: Hi James, Hope you had a great weekend. I’ve attached the formal proposal for the Cloud Sync Expansion. Let me know if anything jumps out, or if you'd like to walk through it together.
Perfect — happy to hop on a call or clarify anything if needed. I also included a few line-item breakdowns in the doc just in case leadership wants more granularity.
Hey Bruce, Reviewed it with our VP — overall no red flags. One minor question on the onboarding costs. Can those be deferred until post-deployment?
Absolutely. We can structure it so onboarding fees kick in 30 days after go-live. I’ll update the proposal and resend it.
That’s perfect. I’ll forward that to finance — that change should check the last box. Appreciate the flexibility.
No problem at all. Revised version attached — let me know if anything else needs adjusting. Otherwise, we’re good to prep contracts.
We can have draft contracts ready early next week. Happy to kick off implementation prep on our end as well. Excited to get this moving.

summary: The sales rep, Bruce Wayne, sent a proposal for Cloud Sync Expansion to prospect James Smith. James raised a minor objection regarding deferring onboarding costs, which Bruce quickly accommodated by updating and resending the proposal. Following James's approval, Bruce confirmed the revised terms and committed to preparing draft contracts and initiating implementation prep, indicating strong progress towards closing the deal.
